conclusion: Determine the minimal angular velocity for the dipole to reverse its orientation considering torque and magnetic forces.
The dipole moment of the system is given by qd aligned along the X-axis.
The torque on the dipole in the magnetic field is qdB in the j direction.
The angular momentum of the dipole about the center of mass is Iω.
The moment of inertia of the dipole is md^2.
Initially, the dipole has angular velocity ω0 and is aligned along the X-axis.
The initial angular momentum is md^2ω0 in the k direction.
For the dipole to reverse its orientation, it must rotate by 180 degrees.
The magnetic potential energy when the dipole is reversed is qdB.
The initial magnetic potential energy is -qdB.
The system must have enough initial angular kinetic energy to overcome the potential energy difference of 2qdB.
Solving for ω_min gives ω_min = sqrt(4qB/md).
The minimal ω0 necessary for the dipole to reverse its orientation is ω_min = sqrt(4qB/md).
